      • isNotAllowedIfAuthenticated

        public boolean isNotAllowedIfAuthenticated()
        Description copied from class: AbstractController
        Method returns true if the controller doesn't allow requests if there is a user already authenticated, this is true for most controllers.
        Specified by:
        isNotAllowedIfAuthenticated in class AbstractController
        Returns:
        True if controller doesn't allow request when user is authenticated, false otherwise

      • handleRequest

        public ViewModel handleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                        throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: Controller
        Processes a view request (either to render or handle submission) and returns a ViewModel that represents the resulting view to be rendered. A null return value indicates that the controller implementation handled the response and committed to it directly (setting status codes, writing directly to the response output stream), etc.
        Specified by:
        handleRequest in interface Controller
        Overrides:
        handleRequest in class AbstractController
        Parameters:
        request - inbound request.
        response - outbound response.
        Returns:
        a View the view to be rendered or null if the response was handled (and committed) directly.
        Throws:
        Exception

                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
